alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 10 at 9:37AM CST until February 13 at 10:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Petit Jean River At Danville. * WHEN...Until late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the river are flooded. Portions of Corinth Road, north of Danville, become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CST Friday the stage was 23.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon, Feb 12th. Before that happens, the river will fall to 20.5 feet by Saturday afternoon, then rise to 20.6 feet later that evening. The river will begin falling again around midnight Saturday night, and continue falling to 16.6 feet Wednesday morning, the 15th. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Crest Time Date Petit Jean River Danville 20.0 23.4 Fri 8 AM 20.5 20.2 19.1 20.6 6PM 2/11 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
